segments.text: I see the boy on that wobbly stool, and I just know he’s going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s reaching for the cookie jar, and the stool is about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless they’re being while the woman is right there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is flooding the floor, and she’s just drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m the only one who sees the danger here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to hurt himself, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at them to be careful before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But they’re all just going about their business like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is so frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know how they can all be so oblivious right now.
segments.speaker: PAR
